citations.narrative:
In one of 3 connected outdoor storage sheds with roll up doors, the shed on the far left is being used to store rabbit and
goat feed. There were 3 pallets within the shed. One of the pallets contained bags of rabbit feed, one of which was
damaged and spilling feed onto the floor, with rodent feces noted on the ground in front of the pallet. The second pallet
contained plastic wrapped goat protein blocks in good condition. The third pallet contained approximately 7 additional
plastic wrapped goat protein blocks in which two were damaged and open. Each of the pallets had a sheet of cardboard
separating the pallet from the feed. The sheet of cardboard beneath the third pallet had several handfuls of broken up
protein block with a large amount of rodent feces and two deceased “pinkie” mice on top of it. This shed is currently
cleaned on a weekly basis and was documented to have been last cleaned on 5/23/25. A large number of flies (too
numerous to count) were also observed, in flight only, within the same storage shed and within the alleyways of the upper
barn. Insects and mammalian pests can be reservoirs for disease, infection and if present in food storage areas can lead
to contamination of feed. A safe and effective program for the control of insect ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian
pests shall be established and maintained.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
In one of 3 connected outdoor storage sheds with roll up doors, the shed on the far left is being used to store rabbit and 
goat feed. There were 3 pallets within the shed. One of the pallets contained bags of rabbit feed, one of which was 
damaged and spilling feed onto the floor, with rodent feces noted on the ground in front of the pallet. The second pallet 
contained plastic wrapped goat protein blocks in good condition. The third pallet contained approximately 7 additional 
plastic wrapped goat protein blocks in which two were damaged and open. Each of the pallets had a sheet of cardboard 
separating the pallet from the feed. The sheet of cardboard beneath the third pallet had several handfuls of broken up 
protein block with a large amount of rodent feces and two deceased “pinkie” mice on top of it. This shed is currently 
cleaned on a weekly basis and was documented to have been last cleaned on 5/23/25. A large number of flies (too 
numerous to count) were also observed, in flight only, within the same storage shed and within the alleyways of the upper 
barn. Insects and mammalian pests can be reservoirs for disease, infection and if present in food storage areas can lead 
to contamination of feed. A safe and effective program for the control of insect ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian 
pests shall be established and maintained. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
